text: Batukeshwar Dutt (18 November 1910 - 20 July 1965) was an Indian revolutionary. He created and planned bombings across India. He was sent to jail for life. He went on many hunger strikes, even when he was in jail. He was abused by many prisoners. He was born in Kanpur, British India. Dutt died in New Delhi, India from a long illness, aged 54. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1910 births Category:1965 deaths Category:Indian activists Category:Indian criminals Category:Prisoners sentenced to life imprisonment Category:Terrorists
title: Batukeshwar Dutt
